answers.answer: Hi , pcos  or (polycystic ovary syndrome ) is where there are  lots of tiny cysts on the ovaries , these cysts produce hormones and   can cause  symptoms such as , absence of periods , increased hairiness , weight gain and insulin resistance which the latter if not controlled can lead to type 2 diabetes . Because of absence of periods it is harder to become pregnant . My friend has this condition and has managed to control the symptoms through diet and exercise and she now has two children . I hope this has been of some help , take care - Silver

Hi. I have PCOS. I have weight gain, hair loss(and hair gain in the wrong areas), low energy, mood swings, irregular periods, etc.  I think that if you get diagnosed with PCOS(and I hope you don't) you will find out that you may not have all of the same symptoms as someone else.  Best wishes.
